qas.question: For about how long does full immunity from the TB vaccine last?
What percentage of kids in the whole world get the BCG vaccine?
Is TB common or uncommon in the United States?
In addition to the U.S. and Canada, what European country sees very few tuberculosis infections?
What segment of the population gets the TB vaccine in countries like Canada with a very low incidence of infection?
What percentage of children have TB?
What disease is common in the UK?
How long do you have to wait to get the TB vaccine?
What is not given to high risk people?

plausible_answers.text: Canada, the United Kingdom, and the United States

qas.question: Which three countries have a high risk of tuberculosis?

context: It is the most widely used vaccine worldwide, with <b5_0>more than <a1_0>90%<b5_0/><a1_0/> of all children being vaccinated. The immunity it induces decreases after <b7_0>about <a0_0>ten years<b7_0/><a0_0/>. As <b6_0>tuberculosis<b6_0/> is <a2_0>uncommon<a2_0/> in most of <b9_0>Canada, <a3_0>the United Kingdom<a3_0/>, and the United States<b9_0/>, <b8_0>BCG<b8_0/> is administered only to those people at <a4_0>high risk<a4_0/>. Part of the reasoning against the use of the vaccine is that it makes the tuberculin skin test falsely positive, reducing the test's use in screening. A number of new vaccines are currently in development.
